measured_by: 5-trial adjusting probability discounting task with hypothetical monetary gains and losses
justification: “Two of the probability discounting tasks involved hypothetical monetary outcomes… 5-trial adjusting probability tasks were used given their efficiency in obtaining an indifference point that can be used to generate a rate of probability discounting.”

measured_by: 5-trial adjusting probability discounting task with hypothetical ethical gains and losses
justification: “The third and fourth probability discounting tasks involved hypothetical ethical outcomes… 5-trial adjusting probability tasks were used… to generate a rate of ethical probability discounting.”

measured_by: 40-trial probability matching task with equal expected value choices
justification: “The probability matching task involved four, 10-trial blocks (40 total trials)… This allowed us to isolate the influence of probability on choice as opposed to the overall amount that could be earned from each option.”

measured_by: MSWO-style preference assessment ranking five ethical statements representing ethical theories
justification: “The final task that all participants completed was a preference assessment for ethical theory… Similar to an MSWO preference assessment, participants were asked to rank five ethical statements from most-to-least important when deciding whether something is the ‘right thing to do’.”
